channel.title: Benjamin P. Wood on BPW
channel.description: Recent content in Benjamin P. Wood on BPW

item.title: CC 2019 PC
item.description: Ben will serve on the program committee for CC 2019. Submit.

item.title: Sabbatical 2017-2018
item.description: Ben is on sabbatical until Fall 2018.

item.title: Valerie Zhao '18 thesis
item.description: Valerie Zhao ‘18 successfully defended her undergraduate thesis on dynamic binary instrumentation.

item.title: Valerie Zhao '18 CRA mention
item.description: Valerie Zhao ‘18 received an Honorable Mention in the 2018 CRA Undergraduate Researcher Awards.

item.title: GE Grant
item.description: GE Global Research and Edison Pioneer Award winner Diwakar Kasibhotla made a generous grant to support our work on flexible and effective data race freedom checking.

item.title: Valerie Zhao '18 @ SPLASH 2017 SRC
item.description: Valerie Zhao ‘18 won 3rd place in the SPLASH 2017 Student Research Competition (undergraduate division), where she presented a poster and talk on her summer REU work at CMU with Darya Melicher and Jonathan Aldrich.

item.title: FIB @ OOPSLA 2017
item.description: Our paper on instrumentation bias for efficient and safe software support for dynamic data race detection in FIB (with Man Cao at Google, Mike Bond at Ohio State, and Dan Grossman at UW) will appear at OOPSLA 2017 in October.

item.title: PARSNIP @ MICRO 2017
item.description: Our paper on efficient hardware support for data race detection in PARSNIP (with Yuanfeng Peng and Joe Devietti at U Penn) will appear at MICRO 2017 in October.

item.title: Anchor Point Assistant Professorship
item.description: Ben was named the inaugural Anchor Point Assistant Professor in Computer Science at Wellesley College.

item.title: Sam Mincheva '17 thesis
item.description: Sam Mincheva ‘17 successfully defended their undergraduate thesis on improving thread locality analysis for locksets.

item.title: RaceChaser+Caper @ CC 2017
item.description: Our paper on lightweight software data race detection (with PLaSS at Ohio State) will appear at CC 2017.

item.title: Kasey Shen '17 @ CCSCNE 2016 SRC
item.description: Kasey Shen ‘17 won 2nd place in the CCSCNE 2016 undergraduate research competition for her lock profiling work.
